xyz.acygn.mokapot

Interface ProxyOrWrapper<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The referent class.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Standin<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndirectStandin

    public interface ProxyOrWrapper<T>
    An interface that marks a class as acting like a proxy or wrapper for another specific class. In other words, objects of the proxy-or-wrapper class "pretend" to be objects of a referent class. The referent class must be a specific, actual class (e.g. the object acts as though it were an instance of the referent class, not one of its subclasses).

    The proxy/wrapper class does not necessarily have to extend the referent class (this may be impossible in some cases), although in most cases it will.

    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ProxyOrWrapper.Namespacer
      The type of a dummy parameter used to prevent naming clashes between ProxyOrWrapper#getReferentClass() and methods of other classes that randomly happen to be named "getReferentClass".

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<T> getReferentClass(ProxyOrWrapper.Namespacer dummy)
      Gets the referent class of this proxy or wrapper class.

    • Method Detail

      • getReferentClass

        Class<T> getReferentClass(ProxyOrWrapper.Namespacer dummy)
        Gets the referent class of this proxy or wrapper class. That is, the class that it's "pretending to have", i.e. the class that's being wrapped or proxied.
        Parameters:
        dummy - A dummy parameter for namespacing purposes (i.e. preventing this method having a naming clash with a method of the wrapped class). Typically null, and must be ignored.
        Returns:
        The referent class.
        See Also:
        Object.getClass()
